text.p: McDonald's Corp has backed off an idea to guarantee customers in the United States it could deliver their order within 55 seconds of having paid for it, the Wall Street Journal said.
In Friday's electronic edition, the Journal said the reversal came after franchisees around the United States voted against the guarantee.
Some franchisees said they opposed the campaign because they envisaged problems with customers and lost profits.
"It's asking too much. People will tend to take advantage," one Texas franchisee said.
The guarantee was to have been offered this summer.
No McDonald's spokesman was immediately available for comment on the report.
